duties_responsibilities.duty: Create and maintain technical documentation for healthcare interoperability projects, including API specifications, data mapping guides, integration workflows, and data exchange protocols.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software developers, healthcare experts, and product managers, to gather information and ensure accurate representation of complex technical concepts.
Develop user guides, tutorials, and knowledge base articles that effectively communicate the functionality of healthcare systems and their interfaces to diverse audiences.
Research, analyze, and interpret clinical data standards, regulatory requirements, and industry guidelines to ensure compliance in all documentation produced.
Work closely with subject matter experts to validate and update existing documentation, ensuring its accuracy and relevance over time.
Assist in the creation and review of test cases and validation documentation to ensure alignment with requirements and standards.
Support the creation of release notes and change logs to communicate updates and improvements to internal teams and end-users.
Participate in the development and improvement of documentation processes and templates to enhance efficiency and consistency.
Collaborate with the marketing and sales teams to provide technical input for external-facing materials, such as whitepapers and product brochures.
Stay abreast of industry trends and technological advancements in healthcare interoperability, SDLC, clinical systems, claims processing, and pharmaceuticals.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Technical Communication, Computer Science, Healthcare Informatics, or a related field. (Master's preferred)
